{"step_by_step_thinking": "In this question, we are asked to determine which pulp horns are likely to get exposed while preparing a Class II cavity on a maxillary first molar. According to the document 'Modified Class II tunnel preparation', a tunnel preparation for restoration of Class II carious lesions in primary molars preserves the marginal ridge and minimizes sacrifice of healthy tooth substructure. This means that during the preparation, the mesiobuccal and distobuccal pulp horns are likely to be exposed.", "answer_choice": "A"}
